page.title: 08Farming in this area
page.content: Most farms in this area are medium sized,stocking cows and sheep.Most of the cows are Friesian cows which supply milk.The milk is collected and taken to the dairy in Appleby. Some cows breed calfs which are sold for meat.Some farmers keep Leicester sheep too.Most land is used to grow grass which is cut for silage or hay and stored for winter feed. A few farmers grow turnips.Most farmers have a lot of machinery.Many farmers have a tractor and a chopper,mower,trailer and a hay bob used at silage time. Most farms at hay time have a bail sledge,bailer and mower. Many farmers in this area have been upset by the cuts in the amount of milk they can produce.
